definition: lit. the horse loses its front hooves/fig. sudden failure through miscalculation or inattentiveness
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
to lose/to miss/to fail
front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly
hoof/pig's trotters

sentences.english: Every service team stumps their toe from time to time.
sentences.chinese: 每個服務團隊都會有馬失前蹄的時候。

sentences.english: She acknowledged that error and said that "he had to do a year over" to cover.
sentences.chinese: 她知道馬失前蹄了，辯稱“他確實需要念多一年書”。

definition: lit. an arrow at the end of its flight (idiom)/fig. spent force
sudden thrust (that catches the opponent off guard)
extraordinary strength/super strong/strong as an ox
economic difficulty
masthead (of a newspaper etc)/nameplate
lit. to directly attack Huanglong/fig. to directly combat the root of a problem
to undress
defensive position/guard
human pyramid
an iron ring
to charge/to pounce on/to swoop down on
to solve or overcome (a difficult problem)/to beat (a video game)
lit. the river that divides Chu and Han/fig. a line that divides rival territories/the mid-line between sides on a Chinese chessboard
to be scared out of one's wits/to scare stiff
to obstruct/to impede
to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
